[h1] Save your SSD and your Sanity. [/h1]

I really wanted to like this game. Visually, it‚Äôs fine. Gunplay is decent. But I cannot in good conscience recommend Delta Force to anyone who values their PC's health or their mental peace.

[h2] The "ACE" Anti-Cheat is Malware. [/h2]
This game forces you to install Tencent's "Anti-Cheat Expert" (ACE). This isn't your standard anti-cheat. It is a kernel-level driver that buries itself deep into your system. It runs in the background, scans your SSD content repeatedly until it breaks.

It is nearly impossible to uninstall. Uninstalling the game leaves ACE behind. You have to manually edit the registry and run CMD commands just to scrub it off your drive.

Hardware Damage: The constant, aggressive scanning and read/write operations punish your SSD unnecessarily. I've noticed significant performance degradation and drive health issues since installing this, even when I am playing other games. It feels less like game security and more like spyware.

[b] And worst thing of all... It doesn't even stop cheaters. [/b]

You sacrifice your system's security for absolutely nothing. The game is infested. Wallhacks and aimbots are ubiquitous. You are handing over kernel access to a company that can't even stop a script kiddy with a free trial hack.

[h2] The Gameplay Loop is Broken [/h2]
The developers have completely destroyed the "Search, Fight, Extract" core of the genre.
If you are a decent player, the hidden matchmaking punishes you. You get thrown into "High Pressure" lobbies where every opponent is either a cheater or is just has better technique, but‚Äîand here is the kicker‚Äîthe searching part feel WORSE. You risk expensive gear for literally nothing.

Meanwhile, lower-skilled players get protected, low-pressure lobbies where high-value loot seems to spawn more frequently to "hook" them in.

It leads to the ultimate Extraction Shooter paradox:

[b] You can't Search: Because the loot density for skilled players is nerfed. [/b]

[b] You can't Fight: Because you are fighting Rage-hackers or ACE-bypassing aimbots. [/b]

[b] You can't Extract: Because the game design ensures you lose the attrition war. [/b]

To make matters worse, the dev team is arrogant and dismissive. They do not care about the legit player base, only engagement metrics.

[b]Do not install. The gameplay isn't worth the hardware risk or the frustration.[/b]

On release when I play this it was an amazing FPS shooter game with amazing attention to detail. Big variety of weapons, attachments, good progression, nice maps, good gameplay overall BUT, then the cheaters came. The game is unplayable sadly, you just can't get into a match without cheaters. -GRAPHICS: 9/10
The game definitely looks good and is up there with it's competitors. No complaints at all here. 

-GAMEPLAY: 9/10
One of the best FPS gameplay wise. There's so much attention to detail that it's ridiculous, in a good way. You can customize your weapons so in depth that no other FPS game allows you to (at least non that I have played before). There's definitely a lot of mechanics taken from the competition, but nothing copied per sah, just inspired. Also I liked the "hold your breathe" for less recoil part of the game, usually other FPS games have this only for the sniper, here it's on all the weapons and using ADS. 

-STORY: -
Didn't play it. Has to be good since it's a remake of the old Black Hawk Down, but sadly I have grown out of single playing FPS games, I only care about the multiplayer. 

-BUGS/GLITCHES: 10/10
Nothing on my playtime. 

-FX/SOUNDTRACK: 8/10
Music is nothing special, just exists on the game, but the FX are amazing and you feel like you're right inside the battle. 

-ORIGINALITY: 6/10
Could've done something a little bit more original, overall the game is just a copy/paste of CoD & Battlefield. Couple of great new mechanics and the customization I mentioned above, but besides those, the game is just a generic FPS. 

-MICRO TRANSACTIONS:
Season passes and cosmetics. 

-WHO SHOULD PLAY THIS:
On release it was spectacular and fun, for maybe a week, after that cheaters became a majority and the game became unplayable. So don't play it nowadays. 

-DIFFICULTY:
Skill based. 

-REPLAYABILITY/LENGTH:
If there weren't cheaters I'd probably still be playing. There's so much to unlock and progress that you always feel like there's a carrot in front of you. Also good and rewarding progression system.

-PC REQUIREMENTS For Max Settings
Pretty decent machine, not as demanding as it's competitors.
